titles.title: Military Investment Resolution
Expressing the sense of the Congress regarding the need to invest a minimum of 4 percent of gross domestic product on national defense.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Armed Services.

bill.summary: 3/13/2003--Introduced. Military Investment Resolution - Expresses the sense of Congress that the United States should invest a minimum of four percent of gross domestic product on national defense in order to reverse the neglect of the 1990s, improve military readiness to necessary defense levels, and promote American values domestically and abroad.
